intro: Maurocenia occidentalis var. leucosperma, commonly known as the white-fruited maurocenia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white, woolly bracts that surround its small, showy flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
